pullRequest.body:
This PR cleans up a few proofs on `FiniteDimensional` vector spaces.

There are a few proofs about `FiniteDimensional` that go via `IsNoetherian` when instead we define `FiniteDimensional` as `Module.Finite`. Of course in the current setup those are equivalent, but we can save some proof steps (and import dependencies for the first half of the file!) if we get rid of them.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Nice, thanks (assuming CI passes)
maintainer delegate
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13677702523/job/38241933804)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13677702523/job/38241934264)
What happens if we just remove this?

We'd get more complicated instance searches: this `infer_instance` requires:
```lean
  [] ‚ùåÔ∏è apply inst‚úù to Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚ùåÔ∏è apply @instFiniteSubtypeMemIdealOfIsNoetherian to Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚ùåÔ∏è apply Finite.self to Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply IsNoetherian.finite to Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply @isNoetherian_submodule' to IsNoetherian K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply isNoetherian_of_isNoetherianRing_of_finite to IsNoetherian K V ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply isNoetherian_of_isNoetherianRing_of_finite to IsNoetherianRing K ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply @PrincipalIdealRing.isNoetherianRing to IsNoetherianRing K ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚ùåÔ∏è apply @EuclideanDomain.to_principal_ideal_domain to IsPrincipalIdealRing K ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply @IsPrincipalIdealRing.of_isNoetherianRing_of_isBezout to IsPrincipalIdealRing K ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply DivisionRing.isPrincipalIdealRing to IsPrincipalIdealRing K ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating IsPrincipalIdealRing K to subgoal IsPrincipalIdealRing K of IsNoetherianRing K ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating IsNoetherianRing K to subgoal IsNoetherianRing K of IsPrincipalIdealRing K ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating IsNoetherianRing K to subgoal IsNoetherianRing K of IsNoetherianRing K ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating IsNoetherianRing K to subgoal IsNoetherianRing K of IsNoetherian K V ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply inst‚úù to Module.Finite K V ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating FiniteDimensional K V to subgoal Module.Finite K V of IsNoetherian K V ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating IsNoetherian K V to subgoal IsNoetherian K V of IsNoetherian K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating IsNoetherian K ‚Ü•S to subgoal IsNoetherian K ‚Ü•S of Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] result IsNoetherian.finite K ‚Ü•S
```
while after this instance it's basically instant:
```lean
  [] new goal Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚ùåÔ∏è apply inst‚úù to Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply @finiteDimensional_submodule to Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] ‚úÖÔ∏è apply inst‚úù to FiniteDimensional K V ‚ñ∂
  [resume] propagating FiniteDimensional K V to subgoal FiniteDimensional K V of Module.Finite K ‚Ü•S ‚ñ∂
  [] result finiteDimensional_submodule S
```
So I would say this works quite well as a shortcut instance.
OK, let's keep it! Maybe adding a comment?

```suggestion
/-- A subspace of a finite-dimensional space is also finite-dimensional.

This is a shortcut instance to simplify inference in the presence of `[FiniteDimensional K V]`.
-/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(LinearAlgebra/FiniteDimensional): simplify proofs
